result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties agree to dismiss and read in count 1.

11:08 AM  Atty Jason Carlos Gonzalez appeared on behalf of Defendant James Ronald Moreira who does not appear (in custody). Prosecuting Atty Timothy Verhoff appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Verhoff:  matter scheduled for PH today.  As it relates to 21CF2827  Ct 1 burglary, State moves to amend to misd theft 943.20(1)(a); in case 22CF251, moves to amend from felony to misd battery 940.19(1a).  No objection.  Ct accespts oral amendment. State in complaince with Chpt 950.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Current: 115 W Doty Street, Dane County Jail, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 05-27-2022)
Prior: c/o DCJ, Madison, WI 53703 United States
Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Request for a set over by Atty Gonzalez.    
NOTE:  email correspondence sent to ADA Al-Homsi on 5/20/2022 by Br 4.  State does not object to set-over; so granted.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

NOTE:   Duty Week competency case  (Br 4)  
-- Defn found competent on 4/18/2022.  WOPH was scheduled for 4/29/2022 in cases 21CF2827 & 22CF251; attys indicated they would have stipulated global resolution on all cases including 21CF2827, 22CF251, 21CM2047, 21CM2387, and requested all cases be scheduled for PLEAS at the same time.  However, at the time of the hearing on 4/28/2022, Atty Gonzalez indicated Defn was not willing to sign waiver of prelim form or discuss agreement.  Attys requested PH be scheduled in Br 4 in cases 21CF2827 and 22CF251 to allow for bindover to Br 17; and all prior cases be returned to Br 17 for PLEAS.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waiver of Prelim on April 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:49 AM  Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Attorney Timothy Verhoff appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gonzalez indicates competency report states DE is competent; they are in agrmt.  ADA Verhoff in agrmt.  Court's colloquy w/DE.  DE states he believes he is competent.  Court finds DE competent to proceed.  At the request of the parties, Br 4 will keep case and schedule WOPH and stipulated PLEAS; Court in agrmt as long as PLEAS is stipulated.  Waiver of Prelim Hearing and stipulated Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 9:30 a.m. in Br 4.
NOTE:  this will include CM cases as well; expecting joint resolution.
filed by C Schoenecker MD
Competency hearing on April 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
from Dr. Schoenecker for an extension to file competency report / SO GRANTED.
order for competency exam distributed electronically
minutes and order for competency exam emailed to DCJ

12:21 PM Defendant in court, in custody.  Attorney William Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE is eligible for SPD but awaiting appt.  State raises competency of DE and requests in-patient evaluation.  DE in agrmt.  Court makes findings regarding DE's competency to proceed and orders evaluation on out-patient basis (at DCJ).  Court expresses concern regarding multiple continuances of STC/Prelims.  Discn on record re: appt of counsel at County's expense.  ADA Brown in agrmt that DE should have representation apptd for him at County expense once evaluation rec'd due to multiple delays due to atty appt.
Competency hearing on April 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
